content: peel me a grape just entertain me champagne me show me you love me kid glove me best way to cheer me cashmere me i m getting hungry peel me a grape -­ dave frishberg simple to knit yet elegant and luxurious when done in a cashmere blend these are the perfect socks to treat yourself or a loved one size women s medium but easily adjusted for smaller or larger sizes finished measurements 8 inches slightly stretched materials 380 yards of fingering weight yarn the sample was knit in dream in color smooshy with cashmere 70% merino 20% cashmere 10% nylon 400 yd per 113 oz skein in colorway cranberry melt to fit a women s size 10 foot you could probably get away with less yardage if your feet are smaller a set of five size 1 double-­ point needles a tapestry needle for kitchenering and weaving in ends gauge 35 stitches/48 row = 4 inches in stockinette stitch directions cast on 72 stitches divide evenly between four needles 18 stitches on each and join to knit in the round make sure you don t twist the cast on row when you join knit in 2x2 rib for at least one inch do more if you prefer left sock leg set up row k1 p1 k3 p1 k6 p1 k3 p1 k1 knit across remaining stitches of row begin cable chart on first needle only knitting the remaining stitches continue until cuff measures seven inches or your desired length heel once you have completed the final leg row turn your knitting and purl back across two needles slipping every other stitch on the next row knit across those same two needles slipping every other stitch continue this heel flap until it is two inches or your desired length ending on a right side row you are now ready to start turning the heel row 1 sl1 p20 p2tog p1 turn row 2 sl1 k7 ssk k1 turn row 3 sl1 p6 p2tog p1 turn continue like this knitting or purling one fewer stitch per row until you run out of stitches if you are resizing this the heel math won t work out use the appropriate numbers for the rounder heel from socknitters heels by the number http //www socknitters com/tips/heels_by_the_number htm pick up and knit stitches along the heel flap continuing the cable pattern across the top of the foot i find that one stitch for every two heel flap row works well for example if your heel flap is 32 row you would pick up 17 stitches foot after this row you should be in the middle of the sole of the foot between the third and fourth needles knit to two stitches before the end of the fourth needle k2tog knit across the next two needles in the established pattern at the beginning of the third needle ssk continue these decreases every other row until you re back to 72 stitches continue foot in cable
